meanings.definition: The act of selling articles, stories, or television programs for simultaneous publication or broadcast in a number of newspapers, magazines, or stations.
meanings.sent1: The syndication of the TV show allowed it to be broadcast on multiple channels at the same time.
meanings.sent2: Newspapers often engage in syndication to share popular content with a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: The syndication of the comic strip to different newspapers made the characters famous everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her idea for syndication was like planting seeds that grew into a forest of readers.
meanings.sent5: The syndication of the article made it accessible to readers across the country.

meanings.definition: The process of forming a syndicate.
meanings.sent1: The syndication of businesses helped them work together for mutual benefit.
meanings.sent2: During the syndication, each member contributed to the success of the group.
meanings.sent3: The syndication of the team was like gathering superheroes for a mission.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, syndication is akin to creating a powerful alliance.
meanings.sent5: The syndication of talents led to an unstoppable force in the industry.
